localised_text.last_approved_text: "Great things start from small beginnings. This is an opportunity to make a name for myself."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "Great things start from small beginnings. This is an opportunity to make a name for myself."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "My father holds an official rank. He supports and shelters me in times of trouble."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "My father holds an official rank. He supports and shelters me in times of trouble."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The heavens are shifting and an ill wind blows through the land. It seems time for a hero of chaos to rise and bring an end to the turmoil."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The heavens are shifting and an ill wind blows through the land. It seems time for a hero of chaos to rise and bring an end to the turmoil."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Cao Song

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Cao Song

localised_text.last_approved_text: "They laugh at the great Dong Zhuo?! They mock me? I will show them all what I am truly capable of!"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "They laugh at the great Dong Zhuo?! They mock me? I will show them all what I am truly capable of!"

localised_text.last_approved_text: "Like the snake, I shall wait to srtike. Like the tiger, I will destroy my enemies. And, like the dragon, I shall rise in glory."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "Like the snake, I shall wait to srtike. Like the tiger, I will destroy my enemies. And, like the dragon, I shall rise in glory."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I am the emperor, divine ruler of China. For the future of my dynasty, I must endure these troubled times."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I am the emperor, divine ruler of China. For the future of my dynasty, I must endure these troubled times."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "My brother-in-law is my most stalwart guardian. He would never let ill become me."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "My brother-in-law is my most stalwart guardian. He would never let ill become me."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Empress He

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Empress He

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The Eunuchs and ministers bicker and fight among themselves. If China's turmoil is to to be quelled, I must navigate these waters."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The Eunuchs and ministers bicker and fight among themselves. If China's turmoil is to to be quelled, I must navigate these waters."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: He Jin

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He Jin

localised_text.last_approved_text: "While I may be a relative of the emperor, I am an impoverished sandalweaver, what can I do to help the people?"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "While I may be a relative of the emperor, I am an impoverished sandalweaver, what can I do to help the people?"

localised_text.last_approved_text: "My old teacher, a wise and honest man.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "My old teacher, a wise and honest man.

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I weep when I see the awful chaos in the capital. If only I had allies, or friends, I would not feel so powerless."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I weep when I see the awful chaos in the capital. If only I had allies, or friends, I would not feel so powerless."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I have lost everything to the schemes of the eunuchs, but I shall not be cowed. I shall found a land where all will be safe from harm."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I have lost everything to the schemes of the eunuchs, but I shall not be cowed. I shall found a land where all will be safe from harm."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "Though I have been gravely mistreated, I am still loyal to the emperor."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "Though I have been gravely mistreated, I am still loyal to the emperor."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Prince Liu Chong

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Prince Liu Chong

localised_text.last_approved_text: "With my stout bow I shall protect my borders from all would-be attackers."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "With my stout bow I shall protect my borders from all would-be attackers."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "My family are suffering at the hands of politicians. I must hold onto what is mine to weather the storm"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "My family are suffering at the hands of politicians. I must hold onto what is mine to weather the storm"

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lu Zhi

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Lu Zhi

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I am a renowned teacher and scholar, and many of those in this land have been shaped by my hand. As a good teacher, I must lead by example."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I am a renowned teacher and scholar, and many of those in this land have been shaped by my hand. As a good teacher, I must lead by example."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "It seems some of my teachings go undeeded in the capital, I shall lead by example then!"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "It seems some of my teachings go undeeded in the capital, I shall lead by example then!"

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I serve the Han loyally, but, as a good merchant, I can see that something is amiss in the capital. How should I proceed?"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I serve the Han loyally, but, as a good merchant, I can see that something is amiss in the capital. How should I proceed?"

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I must protect, not just my lands, but my family as well."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I must protect, not just my lands, but my family as well."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The emperor and his empress are busy battling the eunuchs while the local people suffer. I should bring as many people into my protection as I can."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The emperor and his empress are busy battling the eunuchs while the local people suffer. I should bring as many people into my protection as I can."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "People looks to me to protect them. I must rid the lands of the rebels."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "People looks to me to protect them. I must rid the lands of the rebels."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The radical healer, Zhang Jue, has gained quite a following. This is concerning news."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zhang Bao

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Bao

localised_text.last_approved_text: "I shall support my brothers, and strike like a tiger to secure the future we envision."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "I shall support my brothers, and strike like a tiger to secure the future we envision."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zhang Jue

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Jue

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The Empire of the Han is corrupt and their mandate has faded. To bring peace to this world, the cancour at the heart of the country must be removed."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The Empire of the Han is corrupt and their mandate has faded. To bring peace to this world, the cancour at the heart of the country must be removed."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "My brothers stand with me, together we cannot falter."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "My brothers stand with me, together we cannot falter."

localised_text.last_approved_text: "As the eldest brother, the people look to me for guidance. I must lead my followers to an enlightened future."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "As the eldest brother, the people look to me for guidance. I must lead my followers to an enlightened future."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zhang Liang

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Liang

localised_text.last_approved_text: "While I may be the youngest brother, the responsibility weighs heavy on my sholders. I shall be the bastion that defends the righteous from harm."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "While I may be the youngest brother, the responsibility weighs heavy on my sholders. I shall be the bastion that defends the righteous from harm."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zeal and fervour can take a man far, but when facing an army even a righteous rabble must be aptly prepared. It takes years for a soldier to pass through a military academy and master the skills of warfare; a peasant cannot afford such a luxury when rising in revolt. \n\n Yet any man can hold a weapon, and under an able and insistent captain, be drilled to wield it in an effective, deadly manner. The art of war is not for the privileged alone.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zeal and fervour can take a man far, but when facing an army even a righteous rabble must be aptly prepared. It takes years for a soldier to pass through a military academy and master the skills of warfare; a peasant cannot afford such a luxury when rising in revolt. \n\n Yet any man can hold a weapon, and under an able and insistent captain, be drilled to wield it in an effective, deadly manner. The art of war is not for the privileged alone.

localised_text.last_approved_text: As ploughs and shears can be turned to swords, so farmers can be made into soldiers, with a little training of course.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As ploughs and shears can be turned to swords, so farmers can be made into soldiers, with a little training of course.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mandatory Drill

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Mandatory Drill

localised_text.last_approved_text: The message of the Way is a powerful one, a hopeful one, but it will be an unheard one without those willing to carry that message across the land. Though the Zhang brothers worked out of Julu Commandery, proselytising their message to all around them, they have also been building a network of co-ordinators. \n\n They have taken the message forth, recruiting warriors and readying them for the inevitable call to action. For when they rise, they rise as one!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The message of the Way is a powerful one, a hopeful one, but it will be an unheard one without those willing to carry that message across the land. Though the Zhang brothers worked out of Julu Commandery, proselytising their message to all around them, they have also been building a network of co-ordinators. \n\n They have taken the message forth, recruiting warriors and readying them for the inevitable call to action. For when they rise, they rise as one!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Organised rebellion against a centralised government requires sandals on the ground, encouraging and briefing recruits.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Organised rebellion against a centralised government requires sandals on the ground, encouraging and briefing recruits.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Provincial Co-ordinators

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Provincial Co-ordinators

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Han must be more than toppled; they must be replaced, and so some trappings of their ways must be adopted if victory is to be achieved. An army without order is no more than a rabble, and a rabble, no matter how righteous, cannot topple a dynasty. \n\n Warriors must be ordered and their locations and movements known in order to succeed. Secretaries, to that end, must manage the logistics of the cause, lest it be undone by a lack of diligence.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Han must be more than toppled; they must be replaced, and so some trappings of their ways must be adopted if victory is to be achieved. An army without order is no more than a rabble, and a rabble, no matter how righteous, cannot topple a dynasty. \n\n Warriors must be ordered and their locations and movements known in order to succeed. Secretaries, to that end, must manage the logistics of the cause, lest it be undone by a lack of diligence.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The only way to increase efficiency is through thorough organisation.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The only way to increase efficiency is through thorough organisation.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Followers' Secretaries

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Followers' Secretaries

localised_text.last_approved_text: No one warrior can tear down the Azure Sky alone; he must be supported by an army, thousands strong, to cleave through the firmament and deliver a better world for all. \n\n Although multitudes clamoured to join the Yellow Turban ranks, it is clear that training must be afforded them and camps constructed in which to train them. This should ensure that a degree of regiment and order can be implemented to make the masses an effective fighting force.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: No one warrior can tear down the Azure Sky alone; he must be supported by an army, thousands strong, to cleave through the firmament and deliver a better world for all. \n\n Although multitudes clamoured to join the Yellow Turban ranks, it is clear that training must be afforded them and camps constructed in which to train them. This should ensure that a degree of regiment and order can be implemented to make the masses an effective fighting force.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mass production - even of soldiers - requires advanced processes to be put in place.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Mass production - even of soldiers - requires advanced processes to be put in place.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Advanced Training Camps

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Advanced Training Camps

localised_text.last_approved_text: The peasant is well-used to eking out a meagre living from their land, but the warrior requires more than simple nourishment if they are to fight with adequate fervour. Disparate groups of Yellow Turbans, separated by distance but united by a common cause, must be provided for if the fight is to be won. \n\n To that end, the establishment of supply lines is vital, both to provide for armies in the field and to connect together the distant warriors who have risen to answer the call!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The peasant is well-used to eking out a meagre living from their land, but the warrior requires more than simple nourishment if they are to fight with adequate fervour. Disparate groups of Yellow Turbans, separated by distance but united by a common cause, must be provided for if the fight is to be won. \n\n To that end, the establishment of supply lines is vital, both to provide for armies in the field and to connect together the distant warriors who have risen to answer the call!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Basic equipment and nourishment is not befitting for heroes of battle.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Basic equipment and nourishment is not befitting for heroes of battle.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Specialised Supply Lines

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Specialised Supply Lines

localised_text.last_approved_text: There is no single solution to every problem, and myriad problems must thus require myriad solutions. All across China, brave souls have risen to swell the Yellow Turban ranks, yet each region must be supported in unique ways. \n\n Provisions and weapons are one thing, but the correct armour for the correct terrain and the best weapons for local forces; all these things must be considered, otherwise the rebellion will fail for a lack of planning.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: There is no single solution to every problem, and myriad problems must thus require myriad solutions. All across China, brave souls have risen to swell the Yellow Turban ranks, yet each region must be supported in unique ways. \n\n Provisions and weapons are one thing, but the correct armour for the correct terrain and the best weapons for local forces; all these things must be considered, otherwise the rebellion will fail for a lack of planning.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Someone must ensure there are provisions in place for armies on campaign.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Someone must ensure there are provisions in place for armies on campaign.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Regional Factors

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Regional Factors

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is an adage older than time that an army marches on its stomach, and as the Yellow Turbans increase both in number and territory, there must be the necessary infrastructure to support their swelling rebellion. \n\n Yet not only food is required to sustain an army; medicine, weapons, armour - all these things must be sourced and maintained, ready to be distributed to the army at a moment's notice.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is an adage older than time that an army marches on its stomach, and as the Yellow Turbans increase both in number and territory, there must be the necessary infrastructure to support their swelling rebellion. \n\n Yet not only food is required to sustain an army; medicine, weapons, armour - all these things must be sourced and maintained, ready to be distributed to the army at a moment's notice.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If food, medicine and equipment can be both stored and transported, then armies can fight longer and harder.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If food, medicine and equipment can be both stored and transported, then armies can fight longer and harder.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Increased Storage

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Increased Storage

localised_text.last_approved_text: Before swords ever cross, before spears reach shields, it is arrows that lance across the sky and declare a battle begun. The ammunition of the bowmen, then, is of paramount importance; both the sheer quantity required and the type. \n\n For an arrow to fly far - across a battlefield for instance - the fletcher must make each one carefully, and consistently, to ensure that it travels the required distance, and with enough force to effectively pierce its target.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Before swords ever cross, before spears reach shields, it is arrows that lance across the sky and declare a battle begun. The ammunition of the bowmen, then, is of paramount importance; both the sheer quantity required and the type. \n\n For an arrow to fly far - across a battlefield for instance - the fletcher must make each one carefully, and consistently, to ensure that it travels the required distance, and with enough force to effectively pierce its target.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Killing an animal and killing a man are two very different things, each requiring a different type of arrow.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Killing an animal and killing a man are two very different things, each requiring a different type of arrow.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Military Fletchers

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Military Fletchers

localised_text.last_approved_text: The cause is a just one, and the followers of the Way devout, yet every war will inevitably incur casualties. Such noble losses must be replaced if the effort is to continue. \n\n Originally, it was the Zhang brothers who began preaching the word and recruiting warriors to the cause, but in every corner of the land there must now be those willing to take up that same mantle and bring more faithful people to the fight, that it may continue until victory is achieved!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The cause is a just one, and the followers of the Way devout, yet every war will inevitably incur casualties. Such noble losses must be replaced if the effort is to continue. \n\n Originally, it was the Zhang brothers who began preaching the word and recruiting warriors to the cause, but in every corner of the land there must now be those willing to take up that same mantle and bring more faithful people to the fight, that it may continue until victory is achieved!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Even rebels need to replace fallen soldiers with fresh recruits.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Even rebels need to replace fallen soldiers with fresh recruits.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Recruitment Drives

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Recruitment Drives

localised_text.last_approved_text: As the cause grows more vast, and its victories more numerous, reliance on smaller, local recruitment efforts must give way to broader, more centralised efforts. Once the message has been demonstrated by victory in the field, more will flock to the Way. \n\n But beyond the righteously angry peasantry, the message must reach those already in power, who realise that another way is waiting, a better way, so that they may bring their own forces to bear in tearing down the Han!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As the cause grows more vast, and its victories more numerous, reliance on smaller, local recruitment efforts must give way to broader, more centralised efforts. Once the message has been demonstrated by victory in the field, more will flock to the Way. \n\n But beyond the righteously angry peasantry, the message must reach those already in power, who realise that another way is waiting, a better way, so that they may bring their own forces to bear in tearing down the Han!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Recruiting angry farmers from village halls will only get you so far.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Recruiting angry farmers from village halls will only get you so far.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Centralised Conscription Service

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Centralised Conscription Service

localised_text.last_approved_text: Whilst the Han rely on local warlords to recruit and maintain their own armies to fight in the dynasty's name, the Yellow Turbans suffer no such arbitrary limitations. If they require people, then they can come from any region in the land. \n\n When local issues cannot be fixed with local solutions, the whole will mobilise to fix the sum of its parts; what is needed will be transferred from where there is plenty to where there is little. Equilibrium will be maintained, and victory assured.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Whilst the Han rely on local warlords to recruit and maintain their own armies to fight in the dynasty's name, the Yellow Turbans suffer no such arbitrary limitations. If they require people, then they can come from any region in the land. \n\n When local issues cannot be fixed with local solutions, the whole will mobilise to fix the sum of its parts; what is needed will be transferred from where there is plenty to where there is little. Equilibrium will be maintained, and victory assured.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If the resources are not there to field a new army, go and find it further afield.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If the resources are not there to field a new army, go and find it further afield.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Cross-provincial Mustering

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Cross-provincial Mustering

localised_text.last_approved_text: The nature of the cause is irrepressible; everywhere the Yellow Turban message is heard, more people rise to hear it. Such a message of hope is intoxicating - the people will fight for the idea of a better tomorrow. \n\n As the march to bring down the Azure Sky gains momentum, more and more will be drawn into its orbit, and the swell of soldiers fighting for the Yellow Sky will become beyond counting!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The nature of the cause is irrepressible; everywhere the Yellow Turban message is heard, more people rise to hear it. Such a message of hope is intoxicating - the people will fight for the idea of a better tomorrow. \n\n As the march to bring down the Azure Sky gains momentum, more and more will be drawn into its orbit, and the swell of soldiers fighting for the Yellow Sky will become beyond counting!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The power of the Way will impel those far and wide to join our cause.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The power of the Way will impel those far and wide to join our cause.

localised_text.last_approved_text: March of the Heavenly Way

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: March of the Heavenly Way

localised_text.last_approved_text: A mob is effective as a blunt instrument, but lacks the finesse required to overthrow a military power. Grand strategy, no matter how noble, is seldom a matter of overwhelming your enemy with a flood of force, but rather of the right people in the right place at the right time. \n\n The ability to move quickly and react to changing circumstance sets a victorious commander apart from a forgotten one.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A mob is effective as a blunt instrument, but lacks the finesse required to overthrow a military power. Grand strategy, no matter how noble, is seldom a matter of overwhelming your enemy with a flood of force, but rather of the right people in the right place at the right time. \n\n The ability to move quickly and react to changing circumstance sets a victorious commander apart from a forgotten one.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If the military are agile, so they can be picked up and placed elsewhere, like a Go piece, they will be unavoidable.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If the military are agile, so they can be picked up and placed elsewhere, like a Go piece, they will be unavoidable.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Expedited Deployment

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Expedited Deployment

localised_text.last_approved_text: A rabble may be a terrifying sight, but a closer look reveals they are as dangerous to each other as they are the enemy. Moreover, a mindless mob moving without direction will be slow and inefficient. \n\n Order must be brought and a sense of discipline instilled in those who would fight for their homes and countries. When a unit can move and think as one, they are a worthy fighting force. Anything less is anarchy.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A rabble may be a terrifying sight, but a closer look reveals they are as dangerous to each other as they are the enemy. Moreover, a mindless mob moving without direction will be slow and inefficient. \n\n Order must be brought and a sense of discipline instilled in those who would fight for their homes and countries. When a unit can move and think as one, they are a worthy fighting force. Anything less is anarchy.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Marching in an unkempt group can be laborious, but with drill and discipline a unit can move as one, as fast as a single man.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Marching in an unkempt group can be laborious, but with drill and discipline a unit can move as one, as fast as a single man.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Marching Drills

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Marching Drills

localised_text.last_approved_text: While an army may march with the utmost efficiency, nature itself can help or hinder those who cross its hills and fields; a long summer's march is just as deadly as a slog through wintry climes. \n\n The well-prepared soldier should know how to traverse these inhospitable conditions, but the better-prepared commander should know when to march as to avoid them altogether, for even the most well-stocked of armies is as nothing before the whim of the elements.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: While an army may march with the utmost efficiency, nature itself can help or hinder those who cross its hills and fields; a long summer's march is just as deadly as a slog through wintry climes. \n\n The well-prepared soldier should know how to traverse these inhospitable conditions, but the better-prepared commander should know when to march as to avoid them altogether, for even the most well-stocked of armies is as nothing before the whim of the elements.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Not only distance and supply that must be considered, but the seasons themselves also.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Not only distance and supply that must be considered, but the seasons themselves also.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Advanced Marching Drills

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Advanced Marching Drills

localised_text.last_approved_text: Although the realm and the heavens are bound by a celestial bond - namely, the emperor - we must not think these chains unbreakable. If or when heaven displays its displeasure with the imperial dynasty, the connection must be severed and a new dynasty may be installed - one with celestial blessing. \n\n For whilst the heavens are all powerful, the emperor only rules at their discretion and the people must decide when heaven's patience has run its course.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Although the realm and the heavens are bound by a celestial bond - namely, the emperor - we must not think these chains unbreakable. If or when heaven displays its displeasure with the imperial dynasty, the connection must be severed and a new dynasty may be installed - one with celestial blessing. \n\n For whilst the heavens are all powerful, the emperor only rules at their discretion and the people must decide when heaven's patience has run its course.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The separation of rule and Heaven; lessons to be learned and applied.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The separation of rule and Heaven; lessons to be learned and applied.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Existential Schism

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Existential Schism

localised_text.last_approved_text: The words of the Way may ring the most true to those who have felt the bite of the dynasty's corruption, but the message is not for them alone. Such beliefs can wend their way through villages, along battlements and into the halls of the mighty. \n\n These words, incendiary as they are, may not convince all those with the trappings of power, yet if but one, two or three nobles are swayed by the message then the cause is all the better for it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The words of the Way may ring the most true to those who have felt the bite of the dynasty's corruption, but the message is not for them alone. Such beliefs can wend their way through villages, along battlements and into the halls of the mighty. \n\n These words, incendiary as they are, may not convince all those with the trappings of power, yet if but one, two or three nobles are swayed by the message then the cause is all the better for it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If the leader's message can reach the ears of eunuchs in the imperial court, then it can reach anyone.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If the leader's message can reach the ears of eunuchs in the imperial court, then it can reach anyone.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Building Connections

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Building Connections

localised_text.last_approved_text: When a movement is so singularly built around a codified ideal, that ideal must be available to all. Whilst collections of texts are traditionally reserved for the imperial government or studious scholars, it is only right that the Yellow Turbans too have a repository of their sacred texts. \n\n The Books of Great Peace, the legendary tomes from which the Zhang brothers birthed the rebellion, are in fact ideologies spread across many different scriptures. As such, they need constant reference and study to understand fully.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When a movement is so singularly built around a codified ideal, that ideal must be available to all. Whilst collections of texts are traditionally reserved for the imperial government or studious scholars, it is only right that the Yellow Turbans too have a repository of their sacred texts. \n\n The Books of Great Peace, the legendary tomes from which the Zhang brothers birthed the rebellion, are in fact ideologies spread across many different scriptures. As such, they need constant reference and study to understand fully.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Study is much more effective when done away from the fields.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Study is much more effective when done away from the fields.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Library of Heavenly Works

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Library of Heavenly Works

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is said that to excise the sins and corruption of the world, the people must look to the 'Celestial Masters' to be their guides through the tumult of rebellion and self-correction. \n\n The world is racked by signs of heaven's displeasure: famine, drought, freak occurrences - yet the Celestial Masters are possessed of the knowledge and the purity to begin to drive away such evils and strive towards the Great Peace.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is said that to excise the sins and corruption of the world, the people must look to the 'Celestial Masters' to be their guides through the tumult of rebellion and self-correction. \n\n The world is racked by signs of heaven's displeasure: famine, drought, freak occurrences - yet the Celestial Masters are possessed of the knowledge and the purity to begin to drive away such evils and strive towards the Great Peace.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The swiftest way to spread an idea is to pass it from teacher to student.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The swiftest way to spread an idea is to pass it from teacher to student.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Way of the Celestial Masters

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Way of the Celestial Masters

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is the duty of those leading the cause to craft, then distribute its message, but it is the job of those who hear to take it forward and tell others - to tell the world. \n\n Missionaries are charged with this most vital of objectives: keeping the word of the Way moving ever forward, and thus keeping the cause alive. For, although victory in battle helps to undo the fabric of the Azure Sky, it is in the hearts and minds of the people that the true victory will be won.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is the duty of those leading the cause to craft, then distribute its message, but it is the job of those who hear to take it forward and tell others - to tell the world. \n\n Missionaries are charged with this most vital of objectives: keeping the word of the Way moving ever forward, and thus keeping the cause alive. For, although victory in battle helps to undo the fabric of the Azure Sky, it is in the hearts and minds of the people that the true victory will be won.

localised_text.last_approved_text: When the message comes from the purest source, none can deny it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When the message comes from the purest source, none can deny it.
Missionaries

localised_text.last_approved_text: Although those who lead the rebellion are no greater than those they lead, it is inevitable that directing the energies of such a huge and righteous cause will eventually exact a heavy toll. \n\n To that end, it is only right that those who require a space to reflect, contemplate and plan should have it. The leaders of the cause, those great generals, meditate on the future of the cause, away from prying eyes and inquisitive minds.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Although those who lead the rebellion are no greater than those they lead, it is inevitable that directing the energies of such a huge and righteous cause will eventually exact a heavy toll. \n\n To that end, it is only right that those who require a space to reflect, contemplate and plan should have it. The leaders of the cause, those great generals, meditate on the future of the cause, away from prying eyes and inquisitive minds.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The great of mind and spirit must have a place to go where interruptions are kept to a minimum.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The great of mind and spirit must have a place to go where interruptions are kept to a minimum.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Abode of the Heavenly Masters

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Abode of the Heavenly Masters

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is towards the Great Peace that all must strive - to rid the land and its people of their accumulated sin and begin the process of righting wrongs. Yet such change cannot be affected in an instant, nor can one person purge generations of corruption from themselves overnight. \n\n Cosmic balance is restored through study, endless practice and an unyielding desire to see the land healed - both through their own self-improvement and the improvement of the land through rebellion.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is towards the Great Peace that all must strive - to rid the land and its people of their accumulated sin and begin the process of righting wrongs. Yet such change cannot be affected in an instant, nor can one person purge generations of corruption from themselves overnight. \n\n Cosmic balance is restored through study, endless practice and an unyielding desire to see the land healed - both through their own self-improvement and the improvement of the land through rebellion.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Every master must first take fledgling steps.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Every master must first take fledgling steps.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Practice of the Art of Great Peace

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Practice of the Art of Great Peace

localised_text.last_approved_text: Spirituality manifests to every person in unique ways, yet these individualities still form to create a greater whole; a representation of celestial instruction upon the land. \n\n And although one can better themselves alone, without assistance, it is undeniable that all may benefit from a teacher - a central figure that all may look to and learn from to better the connection between heaven and earth.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Spirituality manifests to every person in unique ways, yet these individualities still form to create a greater whole; a representation of celestial instruction upon the land. \n\n And although one can better themselves alone, without assistance, it is undeniable that all may benefit from a teacher - a central figure that all may look to and learn from to better the connection between heaven and earth.

localised_text.last_approved_text: One can teach a few but it takes an institution to teach the many.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: One can teach a few but it takes an institution to teach the many.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Representation of the Heavens

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Representation of the Heavens

localised_text.last_approved_text: If the heavens approve of the Yellow Turban plight, then surely a celestial gift is bestowed unto them; nature itself should bend to clear a path. It is said, in hushed whispers and excited recollections, that Zhang Jue himself has control of the elements and can invoke the storm at his whim. \n\n More practically, however, the art of knowing the elements, when they make manifest, and how best to utilise them, is a skill any commander should master, should they wish for success.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If the heavens approve of the Yellow Turban plight, then surely a celestial gift is bestowed unto them; nature itself should bend to clear a path. It is said, in hushed whispers and excited recollections, that Zhang Jue himself has control of the elements and can invoke the storm at his whim. \n\n More practically, however, the art of knowing the elements, when they make manifest, and how best to utilise them, is a skill any commander should master, should they wish for success.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Knowing the nature of the world, one can own it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Knowing the nature of the world, one can own it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Command of the Elements

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Command of the Elements

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zhang Jue's knowledge - and some say powers - did not come instantly. His belief and wisdom took many long months of labour and reflection, isolated away in study every day and night. \n\n Whether or not he can control the very elements is a matter of debate, but what is certain is that his zeal and understanding of the Way of Great Peace is without equal, and that he is truly deserving of the epithet 'Great Peace Taoist'.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Jue's knowledge - and some say powers - did not come instantly. His belief and wisdom took many long months of labour and reflection, isolated away in study every day and night. \n\n Whether or not he can control the very elements is a matter of debate, but what is certain is that his zeal and understanding of the Way of Great Peace is without equal, and that he is truly deserving of the epithet 'Great Peace Taoist'.

localised_text.last_approved_text: After many years of practice, Zhang Jue mastered the Will of Heaven.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: After many years of practice, Zhang Jue mastered the Will of Heaven.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Great Peace Taoist

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Great Peace Taoist

localised_text.last_approved_text: We are all, whether we know it or not, holders of a great many sins; even those not our own - we bear upon us the stain of generations of wrongdoing, passed down from our ancestors. Each sin is a scar upon the land that must be absolved if the land is to heal. \n\n The first step is to admit, to confess, that upon all shoulders rests the burden of corruption, and upon those self-same shoulders rests the burden of absolution.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: We are all, whether we know it or not, holders of a great many sins; even those not our own - we bear upon us the stain of generations of wrongdoing, passed down from our ancestors. Each sin is a scar upon the land that must be absolved if the land is to heal. \n\n The first step is to admit, to confess, that upon all shoulders rests the burden of corruption, and upon those self-same shoulders rests the burden of absolution.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Talking to the great healer of your infractions is the first step to enlightenment.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Talking to the great healer of your infractions is the first step to enlightenment.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Confession of Sins

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Confession of Sins

localised_text.last_approved_text: The message, once heard, must be reinforced, ere it withers and dies - choked by corruption. The people have taken to the message with eagerness, but they must keep the cause on their lips and in their hearts. \n\n To that end, places of congregation must rise, that the people may make communities out of their belief and solidify their ideals in the collective unity of the Way.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The message, once heard, must be reinforced, ere it withers and dies - choked by corruption. The people have taken to the message with eagerness, but they must keep the cause on their lips and in their hearts. \n\n To that end, places of congregation must rise, that the people may make communities out of their belief and solidify their ideals in the collective unity of the Way.

localised_text.last_approved_text: With universal access to official places of worship, people can be moulded.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: With universal access to official places of worship, people can be moulded.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Places of Worship

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Places of Worship

localised_text.last_approved_text: A sword is but a tool in battle, but the true weapons are the words wielded before battle is even joined. Oratory through the ages has ever been an effective method to inspire a waiting or wavering force. \n\n When that oratory is tied to a cause more worthy than any other, then an expecting and potentially untested would-be army can be converted, body and mind, into the fist of victory it desperately needs to be.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A sword is but a tool in battle, but the true weapons are the words wielded before battle is even joined. Oratory through the ages has ever been an effective method to inspire a waiting or wavering force. \n\n When that oratory is tied to a cause more worthy than any other, then an expecting and potentially untested would-be army can be converted, body and mind, into the fist of victory it desperately needs to be.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Sometimes all it takes for men to fight is a few carefully chosen words.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Sometimes all it takes for men to fight is a few carefully chosen words.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Rallying Speeches

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Rallying Speeches

localised_text.last_approved_text: Although heaven voices its displeasure through ill omens and natural disasters, it is by the strength of the people that the Mandate will be reclaimed and the land healed. They must look to their own talents and wherewithal to save the land and re-earn heaven's favour. \n\n For although it is through heaven's blessing that one may rule, it is the land which provides for man's needs, and therefore must be provided for through man's efforts.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Although heaven voices its displeasure through ill omens and natural disasters, it is by the strength of the people that the Mandate will be reclaimed and the land healed. They must look to their own talents and wherewithal to save the land and re-earn heaven's favour. \n\n For although it is through heaven's blessing that one may rule, it is the land which provides for man's needs, and therefore must be provided for through man's efforts.

localised_text.last_approved_text: We aspire to be heavenly but it is always the land that will be our home.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: We aspire to be heavenly but it is always the land that will be our home.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Dedication to the Land

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Dedication to the Land

localised_text.last_approved_text: A rebellion is a rebellion only so long as it remains insurgent; once its victories and territories begin to amass, there is a need to establish some semblance of administration - for if the Yellow Turbans are to eventually govern, they must form the structures of government. \n\n To that end, the rebellious rabble must be organised; positions of responsibility must be established and divisions of labour created. For every requirement, there must be a steward - such is good governance.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A rebellion is a rebellion only so long as it remains insurgent; once its victories and territories begin to amass, there is a need to establish some semblance of administration - for if the Yellow Turbans are to eventually govern, they must form the structures of government. \n\n To that end, the rebellious rabble must be organised; positions of responsibility must be established and divisions of labour created. For every requirement, there must be a steward - such is good governance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: As the rebellion grows there is a pressing need to establish some form of governance.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As the rebellion grows there is a pressing need to establish some form of governance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Organisation of the People

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Organisation of the People

localised_text.last_approved_text: To reclaim the Mandate of Heaven has become a military obligation, but to maintain it is a civil duty. When the wars are won and the Han brought low, the Yellow Turbans must adopt that mantle of leadership and form a government that benefits all. \n\n Those who have fought bravely for their homes should return to them, yet those who wish to help shape a new nation must assume offices and titles befitting of their new, heavier responsibilities.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To reclaim the Mandate of Heaven has become a military obligation, but to maintain it is a civil duty. When the wars are won and the Han brought low, the Yellow Turbans must adopt that mantle of leadership and form a government that benefits all. \n\n Those who have fought bravely for their homes should return to them, yet those who wish to help shape a new nation must assume offices and titles befitting of their new, heavier responsibilities.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Having the Mandate of Heaven is one thing, having the numbers to see it through is quite another.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Having the Mandate of Heaven is one thing, having the numbers to see it through is quite another.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Heavenly Governance

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Heavenly Governance

localised_text.last_approved_text: Only through belief, and crucially understanding, will the message of the cause proliferate, grow and prosper. The origins of the Yellow Turbans is the Zhang brothers taking the lessons learned from the Scriptures of Great Peace and telling them to anyone who would listen. \n\n It is a slow process, to convince people of a new way of life, but person by person, town by town and province by province, China will see the light of the Yellow Sky.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Only through belief, and crucially understanding, will the message of the cause proliferate, grow and prosper. The origins of the Yellow Turbans is the Zhang brothers taking the lessons learned from the Scriptures of Great Peace and telling them to anyone who would listen. \n\n It is a slow process, to convince people of a new way of life, but person by person, town by town and province by province, China will see the light of the Yellow Sky.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The true reward is not physical but spiritual.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The true reward is not physical but spiritual.
Indoctrination

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is the consolidation of power in the hands of the corrupt, the selfish and the greedy that led to the rebellion beginning, so it follows that only through togetherness and community will a better world be created. \n\n This sense of community will lead to the development of shared ideals - ideals that the people can achieve together, unified. With this many-as-one mentality, there is nothing that cannot be achieved.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is the consolidation of power in the hands of the corrupt, the selfish and the greedy that led to the rebellion beginning, so it follows that only through togetherness and community will a better world be created. \n\n This sense of community will lead to the development of shared ideals - ideals that the people can achieve together, unified. With this many-as-one mentality, there is nothing that cannot be achieved.

localised_text.last_approved_text: When all work together for a single purpose there is less opportunity for individual benefit.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When all work together for a single purpose there is less opportunity for individual benefit.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Communal Activities

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Communal Activities

localised_text.last_approved_text: Enlightenment is our natural state - it is the form we are meant to be. We have lost our way, mired in the sins of generations. We must, therefore, strive towards our original state, and in so doing enlighten ourselves. \n\n Enlightenment is a state of spiritual perfection, when we have rejected the false desires of our current reality and returned to a simpler, more disciplined state, thus forming a union with heaven and earth. Through inner release, we find balance, and through balance, we are enlightened.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Enlightenment is our natural state - it is the form we are meant to be. We have lost our way, mired in the sins of generations. We must, therefore, strive towards our original state, and in so doing enlighten ourselves. \n\n Enlightenment is a state of spiritual perfection, when we have rejected the false desires of our current reality and returned to a simpler, more disciplined state, thus forming a union with heaven and earth. Through inner release, we find balance, and through balance, we are enlightened.

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is not one's position in life that matters but their position in mind.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is not one's position in life that matters but their position in mind.
Enlightenment

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Yellow Turban uprising may be rooted in a desire to overthrow an unworthy dynasty, but its true cause is to champion the people, and give them room to prosper and grow where they had previously atrophied. \n\n The excesses and vices of the Han have led to drought and famine, smothering the populace and draining the land. When the Yellow Sky finally rises, all that will end - the people will be able to flourish once more!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Yellow Turban uprising may be rooted in a desire to overthrow an unworthy dynasty, but its true cause is to champion the people, and give them room to prosper and grow where they had previously atrophied. \n\n The excesses and vices of the Han have led to drought and famine, smothering the populace and draining the land. When the Yellow Sky finally rises, all that will end - the people will be able to flourish once more!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The promise of a new, more prosperous life will attract the poor and hungry from across the empire.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The promise of a new, more prosperous life will attract the poor and hungry from across the empire.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A New Beginning

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A New Beginning

localised_text.last_approved_text: To teach the Way, one must know the Way - the Way of the Taiping. This is the doctrine inherited and taught by Zhang Jue, and the doctrine that has led the entire realm into rebellion against the inadequacies of the Han. \n\n Zhang Jue was not the first to preach this message to the people, but he is the most effective, and far from the last - his followers take the message of the Way to the corners of the realm, propagating the message to all who will listen.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To teach the Way, one must know the Way - the Way of the Taiping. This is the doctrine inherited and taught by Zhang Jue, and the doctrine that has led the entire realm into rebellion against the inadequacies of the Han. \n\n Zhang Jue was not the first to preach this message to the people, but he is the most effective, and far from the last - his followers take the message of the Way to the corners of the realm, propagating the message to all who will listen.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Jiazi slogan, written by Zhang Jue, was spread throughout the peasantry.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Jiazi slogan, written by Zhang Jue, was spread throughout the peasantry.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Propagation of the Way

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Propagation of the Way

localised_text.last_approved_text: The people, clamouring for succour from an inept and uncaring government, do not usually want for much - only in times of great hardship do they turn to their leaders to help, and the silence is deafening. \n\n A life without interference from the central authority is what all citizens desire most; the ability to live and create communities that stand on their own strength, neither held up or pushed down by overbearing or uncaring rulers.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The people, clamouring for succour from an inept and uncaring government, do not usually want for much - only in times of great hardship do they turn to their leaders to help, and the silence is deafening. \n\n A life without interference from the central authority is what all citizens desire most; the ability to live and create communities that stand on their own strength, neither held up or pushed down by overbearing or uncaring rulers.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Fending for yourself forces you to learn new skills just to survive.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Fending for yourself forces you to learn new skills just to survive.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Self-sufficient Communities

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Self-sufficient Communities

localised_text.last_approved_text: The rebellion, although a military endeavour, is born of compassion between men; of succour and recuperation. Zhang Jue and his brothers, leaders of the movement, began as healers, tending to the sick in their native Julu Commandery. \n\n It is this compassion that forms the true backbone of the rebellion - although it has come to war, the ultimate goal is to heal the land, as much as the Zhang brothers have healed the people.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The rebellion, although a military endeavour, is born of compassion between men; of succour and recuperation. Zhang Jue and his brothers, leaders of the movement, began as healers, tending to the sick in their native Julu Commandery. \n\n It is this compassion that forms the true backbone of the rebellion - although it has come to war, the ultimate goal is to heal the land, as much as the Zhang brothers have healed the people.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Using the power of the Way, all can be cured.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Using the power of the Way, all can be cured.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Centres of Healing

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Centres of Healing

localised_text.last_approved_text: Religion is a spiritual affair taking place in the hearts and minds of its followers, but to truly codify and establish a belief, it must have a centralised place of worship where people can come, share their ideals and pray together. \n\n Before the Zhang brothers, the Way of the Taiping gained popularity despite the condemnation of the Han emperor, Shun, with ornate temples erected. Although ostentatious, a similar practice could work now to strengthen and legitimise the Yellow Turban cause...

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Religion is a spiritual affair taking place in the hearts and minds of its followers, but to truly codify and establish a belief, it must have a centralised place of worship where people can come, share their ideals and pray together. \n\n Before the Zhang brothers, the Way of the Taiping gained popularity despite the condemnation of the Han emperor, Shun, with ornate temples erected. Although ostentatious, a similar practice could work now to strengthen and legitimise the Yellow Turban cause...

localised_text.last_approved_text: There is little point to religion without proper organisation.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: There is little point to religion without proper organisation.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Religious Organisations

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Religious Organisations

localised_text.last_approved_text: Even those who teach must also learn, for it is through the study of their scriptures that they have attained their position as leaders, yet further study can only make them greater still. \n\n It behoves those who lead the rebellion, then, to gather and share their knowledge, reaching greater understanding through the unification of their beliefs, and their application in furthering the cause and bettering the land.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Even those who teach must also learn, for it is through the study of their scriptures that they have attained their position as leaders, yet further study can only make them greater still. \n\n It behoves those who lead the rebellion, then, to gather and share their knowledge, reaching greater understanding through the unification of their beliefs, and their application in furthering the cause and bettering the land.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A place where teachers themselves can learn is essential to the maintenance of any religion.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A place where teachers themselves can learn is essential to the maintenance of any religion.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Order of Ritualists

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Order of Ritualists

localised_text.last_approved_text: Although the Way has been in the minds and on the lips of countless people for generations, it has never achieved official recognition or codification by the government; Taoists are seen often as solitary creatures, yet the Yellow Turban rebellion has at last put that idea to the sword. \n\n For the rebellion to truly thrive and evolve into the next administration of the land, the Tao must become officially recognised and practiced as the true religion of the people.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Although the Way has been in the minds and on the lips of countless people for generations, it has never achieved official recognition or codification by the government; Taoists are seen often as solitary creatures, yet the Yellow Turban rebellion has at last put that idea to the sword. \n\n For the rebellion to truly thrive and evolve into the next administration of the land, the Tao must become officially recognised and practiced as the true religion of the people.

localised_text.last_approved_text: When an idea permeates an entire society you know that the battle for the mind has been won.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When an idea permeates an entire society you know that the battle for the mind has been won.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Institutionalised Taoism

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Institutionalised Taoism

localised_text.last_approved_text: The gulf between the people and those who rule them is so vast and so twisted that few can comprehend ways in which the government might help its people. It is this failing that has led to the Han's loss of the Mandate and the rise of the Yellow Turban cause. \n\n Although an emperor must rule with 'wuwei' - detached - the court must serve the people, and must be understood as approachable and working in the their best interests. There is no room for anything else.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The gulf between the people and those who rule them is so vast and so twisted that few can comprehend ways in which the government might help its people. It is this failing that has led to the Han's loss of the Mandate and the rise of the Yellow Turban cause. \n\n Although an emperor must rule with 'wuwei' - detached - the court must serve the people, and must be understood as approachable and working in the their best interests. There is no room for anything else.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Affinity with the common man makes him willing to come to you for help.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Affinity with the common man makes him willing to come to you for help.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Knowledge of the People

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Knowledge of the People

localised_text.last_approved_text: Inaction can so often lead to discrepancies and such discrepancies can, in turn, lead to profit for the opportunistic. The ideological conflict of the Han court is one of centralised versus decentralised economic power - the strength of the state against the strength of the private magnate. \n\n With the to-and-fro of this struggle, much and more falls between the cracks into the black market, where the wily profiteer can plug the gaps by providing forbidden things to those who are willing to pay for them.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Inaction can so often lead to discrepancies and such discrepancies can, in turn, lead to profit for the opportunistic. The ideological conflict of the Han court is one of centralised versus decentralised economic power - the strength of the state against the strength of the private magnate. \n\n With the to-and-fro of this struggle, much and more falls between the cracks into the black market, where the wily profiteer can plug the gaps by providing forbidden things to those who are willing to pay for them.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Subvert the imperial trading system and you can keep all the profits for yourself.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Subvert the imperial trading system and you can keep all the profits for yourself.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Black Market

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Black Market

localised_text.last_approved_text: The great sickness that infects the land is born of many things - government corruption breeds heavenly displeasure, certainly, but man's callous attitude towards their fellow man is no less sinful a practice. \n\n When one is willing to put aside selfish desires and petty grievances, and endeavours to learn more of their neighbours and strangers, then society improves, and so too the entire realm. Kindness begets kindness, and such compassion is what will ultimately save the land.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The great sickness that infects the land is born of many things - government corruption breeds heavenly displeasure, certainly, but man's callous attitude towards their fellow man is no less sinful a practice. \n\n When one is willing to put aside selfish desires and petty grievances, and endeavours to learn more of their neighbours and strangers, then society improves, and so too the entire realm. Kindness begets kindness, and such compassion is what will ultimately save the land.

localised_text.last_approved_text: When people come together in common purpose the most difficult tasks become trivial.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When people come together in common purpose the most difficult tasks become trivial.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Shared Society

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Shared Society

localised_text.last_approved_text: A stagnant population leads to a stagnant realm, and a stagnant realm cannot survive - it withers, then festers into corruption and destruction. This is China under the Han. Malfeasance has brought torment and death and separated the people from their lives. \n\n A just society never loses sight of its citizens, for it is they who hold the entire realm aloft. When the Yellow Turbans sweep away the Han, a greater connection and respect for the people, as well as a strict adherence to the Way, will create a strong land.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A stagnant population leads to a stagnant realm, and a stagnant realm cannot survive - it withers, then festers into corruption and destruction. This is China under the Han. Malfeasance has brought torment and death and separated the people from their lives. \n\n A just society never loses sight of its citizens, for it is they who hold the entire realm aloft. When the Yellow Turbans sweep away the Han, a greater connection and respect for the people, as well as a strict adherence to the Way, will create a strong land.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Giving all a part to play in the great scheme yields more and better contributions.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Giving all a part to play in the great scheme yields more and better contributions.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Citizens of the Yellow Sky

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Citizens of the Yellow Sky

localised_text.last_approved_text: In a commandery, everything flows towards the centre; labour in the counties is funnelled towards the capital, where it is then distributed to Luoyang, and so the realm. Citizens pay their tithes of crops and taxes to the central government, who use them to provide for all. \n\n Or at least, this is the ideal - the Han have so abandoned these ways that the people suffer, beset by starvation and plague. If China is to heal and the people to know prosperity, these ways must finally end!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: In a commandery, everything flows towards the centre; labour in the counties is funnelled towards the capital, where it is then distributed to Luoyang, and so the realm. Citizens pay their tithes of crops and taxes to the central government, who use them to provide for all. \n\n Or at least, this is the ideal - the Han have so abandoned these ways that the people suffer, beset by starvation and plague. If China is to heal and the people to know prosperity, these ways must finally end!

localised_text.last_approved_text: A region's centre is there to support the people, and they it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A region's centre is there to support the people, and they it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Centres of Mutual Fulfilment

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Centres of Mutual Fulfilment

localised_text.last_approved_text: Whilst many minds may confound a solution, many hands more often solve problems of labour far faster. And despite the woes currently affecting the populace, China is in no short supply of those willing to work. \n\n If the tragedies of the Han's corruptions are to be undone and the realm restored to glory, then all must take up their tools and participate in the enormous effort of rebuilding society.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Whilst many minds may confound a solution, many hands more often solve problems of labour far faster. And despite the woes currently affecting the populace, China is in no short supply of those willing to work. \n\n If the tragedies of the Han's corruptions are to be undone and the realm restored to glory, then all must take up their tools and participate in the enormous effort of rebuilding society.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Throwing people at a task usually speeds it to completion.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Throwing people at a task usually speeds it to completion.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Co-ordinated Construction

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Co-ordinated Construction

localised_text.last_approved_text: When at last swords ring in battle no more, the warriors of the cause wish for nothing more than to lay down their weapons and pick up their tools once more. This rebellion of ordinary citizens against a corrupt nobility is one of peasants and farmers, experts in agriculture and husbandry. \n\n They wish above all to return to their lives and begin contributing to their societies once again, safe in the knowledge that the government will support them in exchange for their efforts.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When at last swords ring in battle no more, the warriors of the cause wish for nothing more than to lay down their weapons and pick up their tools once more. This rebellion of ordinary citizens against a corrupt nobility is one of peasants and farmers, experts in agriculture and husbandry. \n\n They wish above all to return to their lives and begin contributing to their societies once again, safe in the knowledge that the government will support them in exchange for their efforts.

localised_text.last_approved_text: When most of your population are farmers there is no shortage of labour and expertise.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: When most of your population are farmers there is no shortage of labour and expertise.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Peacetime Farm Labour

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Peacetime Farm Labour

localised_text.last_approved_text: A strong dynasty is led by a strong leader, who is in turn held up by the multitudes of citizens below; their skill and talents nourish the land. Such is their importance, that the most skilled of agricultural experts may need to be displaced once the Han have been replaced. \n\n In far flung corners of the land, their expertise may be required, in places where they can apply their learned methods to improve the entire realm.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A strong dynasty is led by a strong leader, who is in turn held up by the multitudes of citizens below; their skill and talents nourish the land. Such is their importance, that the most skilled of agricultural experts may need to be displaced once the Han have been replaced. \n\n In far flung corners of the land, their expertise may be required, in places where they can apply their learned methods to improve the entire realm.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Many farmers flocking to our cause are veterans of the fields; distribute them across counties to aid agriculture nationally.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Many farmers flocking to our cause are veterans of the fields; distribute them across counties to aid agriculture nationally.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Experienced Farmers

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Experienced Farmers

localised_text.last_approved_text: The principle of building a ship is no different than that of building a house, there are simply different parameters. Whilst the ocean remains largely inhospitable, the vast rivers that criss-cross the realm are excellent routes for transporting both men and supplies by ship. \n\n Junk boats have long traversed these waterways. The shipwrights responsible for their construction look to the land to provide the bamboo for construction and the elements to dictate how flat the boats should be in order to navigate the waterways of the realm.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The principle of building a ship is no different than that of building a house, there are simply different parameters. Whilst the ocean remains largely inhospitable, the vast rivers that criss-cross the realm are excellent routes for transporting both men and supplies by ship. \n\n Junk boats have long traversed these waterways. The shipwrights responsible for their construction look to the land to provide the bamboo for construction and the elements to dictate how flat the boats should be in order to navigate the waterways of the realm.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Men who build houses can be trained to build boats.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Men who build houses can be trained to build boats.
Shipwrights

localised_text.last_approved_text: Progress is achieved by constantly inventing and reinventing and improving - never trying to improve leads only to stagnation. The farmer in the field cannot survive by only growing through the summer; instead, he must learn to be constantly harvesting, lest the winter's freeze starve him and his family. \n\n Digging irrigation channels and rotating crops out allows the land to rejuvenate, allowing nature to continue giving back its bounty.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Progress is achieved by constantly inventing and reinventing and improving - never trying to improve leads only to stagnation. The farmer in the field cannot survive by only growing through the summer; instead, he must learn to be constantly harvesting, lest the winter's freeze starve him and his family. \n\n Digging irrigation channels and rotating crops out allows the land to rejuvenate, allowing nature to continue giving back its bounty.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If people are sowing seeds in the fields while others dig irrigation channels by the river, efficiency is doubled.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If people are sowing seeds in the fields while others dig irrigation channels by the river, efficiency is doubled.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Perennial Agriculture

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Perennial Agriculture

localised_text.last_approved_text: The land provides for all if it is treated with the correct respect and consideration, yet it must be prepared and tended if it is to sustain and produce regular crops. Crucially, a field cannot simply grow crops without first being tilled - the soil turned, and softened, after which seeds may be planted and the land irrigated. \n\n If the land is not prepared or, conversely, overworked, then it will rebel; crops will spoil and the soil will return to its untamed, natural state.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The land provides for all if it is treated with the correct respect and consideration, yet it must be prepared and tended if it is to sustain and produce regular crops. Crucially, a field cannot simply grow crops without first being tilled - the soil turned, and softened, after which seeds may be planted and the land irrigated. \n\n If the land is not prepared or, conversely, overworked, then it will rebel; crops will spoil and the soil will return to its untamed, natural state.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Bring wild land up to farming quality to increase the agricultural land available.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Bring wild land up to farming quality to increase the agricultural land available.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Land Conversion

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Land Conversion
