localised_text.last_approved_text: Farming is not the pastime of the peasant or the fancy of the warrior - it is a commitment, a role, that must be approached with the same rigour and discipline as one would approach preparing an army for war. \n\n The farmer rises early to tend to his livestock, then to his crops. This process of maintenance and observation must continue every day, without fail, or else the risk of catastrophe, and thus starvation, looms large.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Farming is not the pastime of the peasant or the fancy of the warrior - it is a commitment, a role, that must be approached with the same rigour and discipline as one would approach preparing an army for war. \n\n The farmer rises early to tend to his livestock, then to his crops. This process of maintenance and observation must continue every day, without fail, or else the risk of catastrophe, and thus starvation, looms large.

localised_text.last_approved_text: To be a soldier takes a great deal of training and discipline; applying that learning to agriculture will increase efficiency.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To be a soldier takes a great deal of training and discipline; applying that learning to agriculture will increase efficiency.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Organised Farming

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Organised Farming

localised_text.last_approved_text: Whilst in matters of fashion and nobility it may be true that function is secondary to form, those who toil the land require more utilitarian approaches. Their farms, their silos, their wells; all must be matters of pragmatism. \n\n The farmhouse must be near to the pastures and to the crops, as comfort is secondary to necessity in harsh, rural China. The wells must be placed within usable distance to the crops they will support. To the farmer, frivolity is but the barest whisper in their mind.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Whilst in matters of fashion and nobility it may be true that function is secondary to form, those who toil the land require more utilitarian approaches. Their farms, their silos, their wells; all must be matters of pragmatism. \n\n The farmhouse must be near to the pastures and to the crops, as comfort is secondary to necessity in harsh, rural China. The wells must be placed within usable distance to the crops they will support. To the farmer, frivolity is but the barest whisper in their mind.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Nations are built from common hands, but designed by great thinkers.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Nations are built from common hands, but designed by great thinkers.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Agricultural Architecture

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Agricultural Architecture

localised_text.last_approved_text: Movement, however slow, is still progress; stagnation is as good as death, particularly in matters of agriculture. When a local government does not oversee, and facilitate, the endeavours of its rural citizens, then such stagnation is sure to occur. \n\n Under the Han, famines and plagues have riven the land, brought about in part by governmental negligence and corruption. The steady guiding hand of a worthy leader is lacking, and all suffer for it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Movement, however slow, is still progress; stagnation is as good as death, particularly in matters of agriculture. When a local government does not oversee, and facilitate, the endeavours of its rural citizens, then such stagnation is sure to occur. \n\n Under the Han, famines and plagues have riven the land, brought about in part by governmental negligence and corruption. The steady guiding hand of a worthy leader is lacking, and all suffer for it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: If a province's outer reaches are not organised efficiently, how can it ever develop?

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If a province's outer reaches are not organised efficiently, how can it ever develop?

localised_text.last_approved_text: Improved Rural Administration

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Improved Rural Administration

localised_text.last_approved_text: An over-powerful government can wreak havoc for the hardworking peasant, yet an unshackled local family can have equally detrimental effects. For the people to know freedom enough to thrive, yet understand their responsibility to the realm, it follows that the power of the local magnate must be checked and the strength of the government re-established. \n\n This decentralisation of power has only increased under the Han, as authority has slipped between their fingers - it is time now to redress that balance.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: An over-powerful government can wreak havoc for the hardworking peasant, yet an unshackled local family can have equally detrimental effects. For the people to know freedom enough to thrive, yet understand their responsibility to the realm, it follows that the power of the local magnate must be checked and the strength of the government re-established. \n\n This decentralisation of power has only increased under the Han, as authority has slipped between their fingers - it is time now to redress that balance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: To realise the full potential of the land, total control must be acquired.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To realise the full potential of the land, total control must be acquired.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Countryside Control

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Countryside Control

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is a guiding principle of all things that the simpler something is to achieve, then the more likely it is to be achieved; money is no different - if it is simple to buy, then people will buy more. \n\n The development of coinage, and therefore less reliance on bartering, creates stronger and simpler connections between commanderies, facilitating an increase in available goods and services across the whole land.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is a guiding principle of all things that the simpler something is to achieve, then the more likely it is to be achieved; money is no different - if it is simple to buy, then people will buy more. \n\n The development of coinage, and therefore less reliance on bartering, creates stronger and simpler connections between commanderies, facilitating an increase in available goods and services across the whole land.

localised_text.last_approved_text: By decreasing the time needed to complete the buying and selling process, the better the health of the treasury.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: By decreasing the time needed to complete the buying and selling process, the better the health of the treasury.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Simplified Transactions

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Simplified Transactions

localised_text.last_approved_text: In all things, skill increases with practice and mastery is the process of many long, hard-trained hours. All those who come to the Yellow Turbans do so with an enthusiastic zeal yet an inexperienced mind. \n\n That mind must be honed and sharpened, as a weapon would be, before they can begin to strive towards betterment. However, that enthusiasm and zealous fury is vital in all followers of the Way; it will carry them from their humble beginnings to their eventual enlightenment.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: In all things, skill increases with practice and mastery is the process of many long, hard-trained hours. All those who come to the Yellow Turbans do so with an enthusiastic zeal yet an inexperienced mind. \n\n That mind must be honed and sharpened, as a weapon would be, before they can begin to strive towards betterment. However, that enthusiasm and zealous fury is vital in all followers of the Way; it will carry them from their humble beginnings to their eventual enlightenment.

localised_text.last_approved_text: At the beginning of a new journey all must learn the new way.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: At the beginning of a new journey all must learn the new way.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yellow Sky Apprentice

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yellow Sky Apprentice

localised_text.last_approved_text: As the rebellion grows and spreads, its followers take with them a message passed down to them from Zhang Jue himself - "the Azure Sky is dead; the Yellow Sky will soon rise!" \n\n The Zhang brothers quickly spread this message to their followers, who now carry it on their lips on every march and in every battle; it is the slogan that now defines the essence of the movement they gladly lay down their lives to uphold.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As the rebellion grows and spreads, its followers take with them a message passed down to them from Zhang Jue himself - "the Azure Sky is dead; the Yellow Sky will soon rise!" \n\n The Zhang brothers quickly spread this message to their followers, who now carry it on their lips on every march and in every battle; it is the slogan that now defines the essence of the movement they gladly lay down their lives to uphold.

localised_text.last_approved_text: "The Azure Sky is already dead; the Yellow Sky will soon rise. Pass it on!"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "The Azure Sky is already dead; the Yellow Sky will soon rise. Pass it on!"

localised_text.last_approved_text: Speaker of the Leader's Message

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Speaker of the Leader's Message

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is only through self-reflection and meditation that we can achieve enlightenment, shedding ourselves of generations of sin through self-understanding and betterment. \n\n Those who commune with the world beyond our mortal one - the Celestial Masters - reveal the ways of healing, teaching the people to focus on their inner Tao and find balance, restoring both themselves and then the land itself.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is only through self-reflection and meditation that we can achieve enlightenment, shedding ourselves of generations of sin through self-understanding and betterment. \n\n Those who commune with the world beyond our mortal one - the Celestial Masters - reveal the ways of healing, teaching the people to focus on their inner Tao and find balance, restoring both themselves and then the land itself.

localised_text.last_approved_text: "There are some who can see the other world and commune with the spirits who reside there; they know the true way."

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "There are some who can see the other world and commune with the spirits who reside there; they know the true way."

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mediation with the Otherworld

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Mediation with the Otherworld

localised_text.last_approved_text: The most basic of belief of Taoism is the following of the Way, fundamental tenets of nature. Everything must adhere to these tenets if harmony is to be achieved and balance maintained between the world and heaven. \n\n The cosmos is one of opposites, eternal constants that must oppose one another for balance; in nature - as in all things - this balance must be strictly maintained and the Tao adhered to, lest there be chaos.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The most basic of belief of Taoism is the following of the Way, fundamental tenets of nature. Everything must adhere to these tenets if harmony is to be achieved and balance maintained between the world and heaven. \n\n The cosmos is one of opposites, eternal constants that must oppose one another for balance; in nature - as in all things - this balance must be strictly maintained and the Tao adhered to, lest there be chaos.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Perfection is achieved by removing obstacles that deviate one from the true path.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Perfection is achieved by removing obstacles that deviate one from the true path.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Strict Adherence to the Way

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Strict Adherence to the Way

localised_text.last_approved_text: Although Taoism preaches of balance and harmony between heaven and man, the Taipingjing declares that chaos is born of corrupt and unworthy officials, and that things can only be restored to a harmonious state through their removal. \n\n People, as is known, are reluctant to concede power, and so peace must give way to conflict for the restoration of order. When war comes, let it be swift, that peace and harmony may reign once more.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Although Taoism preaches of balance and harmony between heaven and man, the Taipingjing declares that chaos is born of corrupt and unworthy officials, and that things can only be restored to a harmonious state through their removal. \n\n People, as is known, are reluctant to concede power, and so peace must give way to conflict for the restoration of order. When war comes, let it be swift, that peace and harmony may reign once more.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Removing the ruler of the land, whether they've failed or not, is usually done by force of arms rather than the use of words.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Removing the ruler of the land, whether they've failed or not, is usually done by force of arms rather than the use of words.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Way of War

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Way of War

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is the connection between heaven and man that defines a ruler's authority; when the connection is weak, the ruler is failing the heavy burden placed upon them and must alter their ways or face removal. \n\n Only through understanding and communion with the celestial can balance be restored and the natural way brought to balance; only then will the people know peace and security.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is the connection between heaven and man that defines a ruler's authority; when the connection is weak, the ruler is failing the heavy burden placed upon them and must alter their ways or face removal. \n\n Only through understanding and communion with the celestial can balance be restored and the natural way brought to balance; only then will the people know peace and security.

localised_text.last_approved_text: To the commoner, it is essential that they are witness to, or told stories of, Heaven's Mandate.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To the commoner, it is essential that they are witness to, or told stories of, Heaven's Mandate.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Communion with Heaven

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Communion with Heaven

localised_text.last_approved_text: Though Zhang Jue is known as a great healer and learned student of the Way, there is much and more to be said for the idea of mysticism, and the imagined belief of his supernatural powers. \n\n Some speak of Zhang Jue receiving the Scriptures of Great Peace from the immortal spirits of the south lands, saying that his knowledge gives him the power over the elements. Regardless of the truth of these rumours, the belief inspires Zhang Jue's followers and terrifies his enemies.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Though Zhang Jue is known as a great healer and learned student of the Way, there is much and more to be said for the idea of mysticism, and the imagined belief of his supernatural powers. \n\n Some speak of Zhang Jue receiving the Scriptures of Great Peace from the immortal spirits of the south lands, saying that his knowledge gives him the power over the elements. Regardless of the truth of these rumours, the belief inspires Zhang Jue's followers and terrifies his enemies.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Knowing the deeper workings of the universe is a foundation to the end of conflict.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Knowing the deeper workings of the universe is a foundation to the end of conflict.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Faith & Magic

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Faith & Magic

localised_text.last_approved_text: One may fight for many things - their country, their friends, their principles. They may be induced to fight, ordered to fight, but never as effectively if they do not believe in the cause. \n\n The Yellow Turban movement is built on an unshakeable foundation of belief, one that drives its followers ever forward to tear down their corrupt oppressors, and a hope that together they may restore the natural order of things and once again know peace.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: One may fight for many things - their country, their friends, their principles. They may be induced to fight, ordered to fight, but never as effectively if they do not believe in the cause. \n\n The Yellow Turban movement is built on an unshakeable foundation of belief, one that drives its followers ever forward to tear down their corrupt oppressors, and a hope that together they may restore the natural order of things and once again know peace.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Unbridled fanaticism is usually the only thing that can remove the grip of unjust rule over the people.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Unbridled fanaticism is usually the only thing that can remove the grip of unjust rule over the people.
Zealotry

localised_text.last_approved_text: Man has brought about the conditions of his own destruction. This is the fundamental concept of the Taipingjing; the spirit is sullied by an individual's sins and the sins of their ancestors. \n\n Heaven reflects the discord of man, and so corrupted spirits manifest through natural disasters, great plagues and famines. Only through self-reflection and self-sacrifice can these sins be purged and peace restored.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Man has brought about the conditions of his own destruction. This is the fundamental concept of the Taipingjing; the spirit is sullied by an individual's sins and the sins of their ancestors. \n\n Heaven reflects the discord of man, and so corrupted spirits manifest through natural disasters, great plagues and famines. Only through self-reflection and self-sacrifice can these sins be purged and peace restored.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Inside everyone is a spirit that seeks independence. Only by taking this illusion away can peace be brought.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Inside everyone is a spirit that seeks independence. Only by taking this illusion away can peace be brought.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Control of the Spirit

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Control of the Spirit

localised_text.last_approved_text: Nature above all - this the fundamental principle of the Way. When nature is in harmony, so too is the cosmos, and thus prosperity follows. The disharmony between heaven and man has left the earth riven - famine, drought and death all followed in the wake of corruption. \n\n Those who now seek to heal the land, tending to the earth as they tend to their spirits, are worthy of the greatest accolades and will surely be the ones who help lead us into a better future.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Nature above all - this the fundamental principle of the Way. When nature is in harmony, so too is the cosmos, and thus prosperity follows. The disharmony between heaven and man has left the earth riven - famine, drought and death all followed in the wake of corruption. \n\n Those who now seek to heal the land, tending to the earth as they tend to their spirits, are worthy of the greatest accolades and will surely be the ones who help lead us into a better future.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Those who devote themselves to the earth are, in turn, rewarded with its wisdom.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Those who devote themselves to the earth are, in turn, rewarded with its wisdom.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Children of the Earth

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Children of the Earth

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is one thing to imagine the solution to a problem, it is entirely another to successfully put it into practice. Even when an idea is implemented, it is unlikely to be successful on its first iteration. \n\n If the Yellow Turbans are ever to supplant the Han and rule, refining their method of government is beyond vital. The failings of the Han are clear for all to see, yet the perfection of the Yellow Turbans must be even more visible.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is one thing to imagine the solution to a problem, it is entirely another to successfully put it into practice. Even when an idea is implemented, it is unlikely to be successful on its first iteration. \n\n If the Yellow Turbans are ever to supplant the Han and rule, refining their method of government is beyond vital. The failings of the Han are clear for all to see, yet the perfection of the Yellow Turbans must be even more visible.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Having ideas is easy; realising them takes countless repetitions.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Having ideas is easy; realising them takes countless repetitions.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Perfecting the Standard

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Perfecting the Standard

localised_text.last_approved_text: Change can only be brought about by those bold enough to stride forth, regardless of the risk, and bend the arc of history to their will. Zhang Jue, amongst others, is such a figure; he knows that he must be the bulwark of the Yellow Turbans, yet he knows that he cannot fashion a new dynasty alone. \n\n The people must act through him, speaking with a unified voice and acting with a unified hand to become the change that China so desperately needs.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Change can only be brought about by those bold enough to stride forth, regardless of the risk, and bend the arc of history to their will. Zhang Jue, amongst others, is such a figure; he knows that he must be the bulwark of the Yellow Turbans, yet he knows that he cannot fashion a new dynasty alone. \n\n The people must act through him, speaking with a unified voice and acting with a unified hand to become the change that China so desperately needs.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A river, if it is to be redirected, cannot be done so with a paper screen. Ditches and banks must be built.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A river, if it is to be redirected, cannot be done so with a paper screen. Ditches and banks must be built.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Bastion of Change

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Bastion of Change

localised_text.last_approved_text: Violence is never a desirable solution, but it is sometimes an inevitable one. The Way states that the source of the land's sickness is corrupt leaders who must be removed, but if they refuse to cede their power, military action becomes the only option. \n\n Great heroes must therefore step forward to do what must be done; the Yellow Turbans desire peace, but have great need of warriors who will fight to help see the Yellow Sky ascend.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Violence is never a desirable solution, but it is sometimes an inevitable one. The Way states that the source of the land's sickness is corrupt leaders who must be removed, but if they refuse to cede their power, military action becomes the only option. \n\n Great heroes must therefore step forward to do what must be done; the Yellow Turbans desire peace, but have great need of warriors who will fight to help see the Yellow Sky ascend.

localised_text.last_approved_text: To rid the world of the most awful corruption, the most talented must be sent forth.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: To rid the world of the most awful corruption, the most talented must be sent forth.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Heavenly Execution

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Heavenly Execution

localised_text.last_approved_text: The message of the Way must be propagated to every corner of the land, even if it must occasionally be prosecuted with force. Those most ardent followers of the cause can be relied upon to struggle against the forces of corruption that blight both heaven and earth. \n\n These determined vanguards are vested with the authority to act, both to fight and to spread the message across the land to all who would receive it.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The message of the Way must be propagated to every corner of the land, even if it must occasionally be prosecuted with force. Those most ardent followers of the cause can be relied upon to struggle against the forces of corruption that blight both heaven and earth. \n\n These determined vanguards are vested with the authority to act, both to fight and to spread the message across the land to all who would receive it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A devoted follower can, given the proper charge, enlighten many. Then they, in turn, will enlighten even more.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A devoted follower can, given the proper charge, enlighten many. Then they, in turn, will enlighten even more.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Devoted Authority

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Devoted Authority

localised_text.last_approved_text: If the land is to be healed and peace achieved, we must all become paragons. A paragon of the Way is one who has identified their sins and those of their ancestors, then worked to absolve themselves. \n\n Through confession and intense prayer and reflection, they can find their way to a more enlightened state. This purity is the state towards which all should aspire, and is one of the fundaments of the Yellow Turban cause.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: If the land is to be healed and peace achieved, we must all become paragons. A paragon of the Way is one who has identified their sins and those of their ancestors, then worked to absolve themselves. \n\n Through confession and intense prayer and reflection, they can find their way to a more enlightened state. This purity is the state towards which all should aspire, and is one of the fundaments of the Yellow Turban cause.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Fill a vessel with nothing but water and you will get an untainted drink; the same is true of soldiers and their orders.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Fill a vessel with nothing but water and you will get an untainted drink; the same is true of soldiers and their orders.
Purity

localised_text.last_approved_text: True power is not mastery of external might, but of internal, spiritual strength. Self-reflection is the key to understanding, enlightenment and thus true strength. \n\n Yet this spiritual and mental power can only come through discipline and rigorous adherence to the tenets of the Way - living naturally, without excess, and striving ever towards a more harmonious existence.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: True power is not mastery of external might, but of internal, spiritual strength. Self-reflection is the key to understanding, enlightenment and thus true strength. \n\n Yet this spiritual and mental power can only come through discipline and rigorous adherence to the tenets of the Way - living naturally, without excess, and striving ever towards a more harmonious existence.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Years of meditation and training of the mind will also condition the body.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Years of meditation and training of the mind will also condition the body.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Philosophical Discipline

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Philosophical Discipline

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Mandate of Heaven gives the emperor the right to rule, but it is not absolute - it is dependent on heaven's judgement. It is up to the people to determine if the Mandate has been lost to an emperor, through the interpretation of worldly events; famines, droughts and plagues are all seen as signs of celestial displeasure. \n\n If the Mandate is believed to have been lost, then the recourse is to depose the emperor, through force of arms if needed, and prove to the heavens that there is a new, worthy leader.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Mandate of Heaven gives the emperor the right to rule, but it is not absolute - it is dependent on heaven's judgement. It is up to the people to determine if the Mandate has been lost to an emperor, through the interpretation of worldly events; famines, droughts and plagues are all seen as signs of celestial displeasure. \n\n If the Mandate is believed to have been lost, then the recourse is to depose the emperor, through force of arms if needed, and prove to the heavens that there is a new, worthy leader.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Put the best, most fanatical fighters into the same unit, then show me who can stand in their way.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Put the best, most fanatical fighters into the same unit, then show me who can stand in their way.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Enforcing the Mandate

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Enforcing the Mandate

localised_text.last_approved_text: Patience may yield rewards eventually, yet force can sometimes bring a more immediate result. To besiege a settlement is to undertake the most difficult of conquests - overcoming more than just flesh, but defensible stone and determined defenders. \n\n High walls and sturdy gates present the most difficult challenges, yet a catapult makes short work of stone defences, whilst battering rams splinter gates like so much kindling.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Patience may yield rewards eventually, yet force can sometimes bring a more immediate result. To besiege a settlement is to undertake the most difficult of conquests - overcoming more than just flesh, but defensible stone and determined defenders. \n\n High walls and sturdy gates present the most difficult challenges, yet a catapult makes short work of stone defences, whilst battering rams splinter gates like so much kindling.

localised_text.last_approved_text: There is no more satisfying or effective way to bring down a wall than to fling massive lumps of rock at it. This, in itself, takes no little skill.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: There is no more satisfying or effective way to bring down a wall than to fling massive lumps of rock at it. This, in itself, takes no little skill.

localised_text.last_approved_text: General of Flying Stones

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: General of Flying Stones

localised_text.last_approved_text: Do what you must, lord, to ensure that order is restored and the safety and prosperity of China is assured!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Do what you must, lord, to ensure that order is restored and the safety and prosperity of China is assured!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Go forth, Cao Cao, and unite what has been divided!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Go forth, Cao Cao, and unite what has been divided!

localised_text.last_approved_text: A storm is coming, Dong Zhuo… Take arms, and see that it is the likes of which the Han has never seen!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A storm is coming, Dong Zhuo… Take arms, and see that it is the likes of which the Han has never seen!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The time to act is now, Liu Bei; the Han Dynasty must be saved, even if it is by force!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The time to act is now, Liu Bei; the Han Dynasty must be saved, even if it is by force!

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is your duty to ensure that the Han Dynasty survives, Liu Biao; do what must be done to see that it is so!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: It is your duty to ensure that the Han Dynasty survives, Liu Biao; do what must be done to see that it is so!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Remain vigilant, my prince, until such a time that you have the strength and allies necessary to restore the Han to its former glory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Remain vigilant, my prince, until such a time that you have the strength and allies necessary to restore the Han to its former glory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: You must do everything in your power to ensure that order is maintained, excellency, and – if necessary – bring any rogue elements to heel, both across the empire and within your court.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: You must do everything in your power to ensure that order is maintained, excellency, and – if necessary – bring any rogue elements to heel, both across the empire and within your court.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Do not stand idly by, Lu Zhi; through your wisdom and strength, guide the people to a better, brighter future!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Do not stand idly by, Lu Zhi; through your wisdom and strength, guide the people to a better, brighter future!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Let none stand in the way of your ambition, Sun Jian; for your family, and for China!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Let none stand in the way of your ambition, Sun Jian; for your family, and for China!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The path is clear, Tao Qian; either the Han will endure, or a new dynasty must rise for the good of all!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The path is clear, Tao Qian; either the Han will endure, or a new dynasty must rise for the good of all!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nDong Zhuo cannot be allowed to wield such power unchecked.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nDong Zhuo cannot be allowed to wield such power unchecked.

localised_text.last_approved_text:
- the empire remains in jeopardy.

Emperor Liu Hong is dead, his legacy threatened by the vile ambitions of warlords and beaurocrats. Our noble ally and war hero Dong Zhuo has taken the young imperial heir under his wing, but we must prepare; conflict is inevitable.

Do what you must to help keep the empire safe from rogue ambitions, even if that means stepping in and assuming control yourself.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
- the empire remains in jeopardy.

Emperor Liu Hong is dead, his legacy threatened by the vile ambitions of warlords and beaurocrats. Our noble ally and war hero Dong Zhuo has taken the young imperial heir under his wing, but we must prepare; conflict is inevitable.

Do what you must to help keep the empire safe from rogue ambitions, even if that means stepping in and assuming control yourself.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nIt is clear that only you have the capability to end Dong Zhuo's tyranny and restore peace and order to the Han.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nIt is clear that only you have the capability to end Dong Zhuo's tyranny and restore peace and order to the Han.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nDong Zhuo holds your kin – and by extension, the very empire! – by swordpoint.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nDong Zhuo holds your kin – and by extension, the very empire! – by swordpoint.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nIt is not unthinkable that Dong Zhuo will eventually seek to supplant the emperor.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nIt is not unthinkable that Dong Zhuo will eventually seek to supplant the emperor.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThe tyrant is not to be underestimated; having made it thus far, he poses a greater threat to the Han than ever.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nThe tyrant is not to be underestimated; having made it thus far, he poses a greater threat to the Han than ever.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nDong Zhuo is an animal, lacking even the most basic virtues expected of a leader.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nDong Zhuo is an animal, lacking even the most basic virtues expected of a leader.

localised_text.last_approved_text: - the empire now faces an even darker crisis.\n\nThe warlord Dong Zhuo – once considered a paragon of Han virtues and military prowess – has declared himself regent to the child emperor and through him seeks to manipulate the empire to his own ends! This tyranny will not stand!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: - the empire now faces an even darker crisis.\n\nThe warlord Dong Zhuo – once considered a paragon of Han virtues and military prowess – has declared himself regent to the child emperor and through him seeks to manipulate the empire to his own ends! This tyranny will not stand!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThe mad dog has made his move, and if his tyranny is to be ended the Tiger must strike!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nThe mad dog has made his move, and if his tyranny is to be ended the Tiger must strike!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nIn his ambition to wield absolute power, Dong Zhuo has revealed himself as an enemy of the people.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nIn his ambition to wield absolute power, Dong Zhuo has revealed himself as an enemy of the people.

localised_text.last_approved_text:
.

The empress dowager has thrown her lot in with a cabal of corrupt eunuchs who now wield absolute power over the Han and the child emperor. Prepare yourself; conflict is inevitable, and order must be restored.

The eunuchs' ambitions know no bounds; the child emperor must be liberated from their clutches at all costs, or a new order established for the good of all.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nFirst, the regency; then, the empire! You cannot allow a charlatan wield absolute control.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThe pieces are in place and the game has been set in motion; regardless of this so-called regent's intentions, you must now seize control and restore order to the Han.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThis fool thinks they have the mettle to dominate the Han, but none can possibly stand before your might.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThis regency is a mockery of tradition, nothing more than a thinly veiled attempt at holding your kin – and by extension, the empire! – hostage.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nMaintain your strength whilst continuing to assert your influence among the people and within the court; the day will come when you are recognised as the true power behind the throne and you can unite the people once and for all!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nMaintain your strength whilst continuing to assert your influence among the people and within the court; the day will come when you are recognised as the true power behind the throne and you can unite the people once and for all!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nYou are destined for greatness, Cao Cao, and the failings of the House of Han are clear for all to see; continue to build your prestige and influence, and unite this fragile empire under your great and noble banner!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nYou are destined for greatness, Cao Cao, and the failings of the House of Han are clear for all to see; continue to build your prestige and influence, and unite this fragile empire under your great and noble banner!

localised_text.last_approved_text:
– through your conquest of Luoyang – you have assumed defacto control of the Han Empire.

China is yours to do with as you please, but there will surely be those who do not share your vision for the empire; exploit your unique position in order to build your strength and influence.

Then, when all the land is in your thrall, seize the throne once and for all and forge ahead with your own great dynasty!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: - with Luoyang under your protection you now preside as regent to the young emperor.\n\nSteward of the Han! It is your solemn duty to maintain peace and order, yet there will be those who covet your position, perhaps even the throne itself; a storm is coming, and you must be prepared.

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThe emperor, your kin – and indeed, the people! – require a just and noble hand to guide them, Liu Bei. Scion to the Han Dynasty, there is none more worthy of the task than you!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nThe emperor, your kin – and indeed, the people! – require a just and noble hand to guide them, Liu Bei. Scion to the Han Dynasty, there is none more worthy of the task than you!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nFrom exile to exalted, you have proven yourself worthy of the greatest challenge a governor might face, Liu Biao – to administer an empire, and in so doing to help reform it for the good of the people. Do what must be done!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nFrom exile to exalted, you have proven yourself worthy of the greatest challenge a governor might face, Liu Biao – to administer an empire, and in so doing to help reform it for the good of the people. Do what must be done!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nPrince of Chen, defender of the defenceless, it falls upon you to protect your imperial cousin and – most importantly – his legacy. Come what may, the House of Han must prevail; a prince will become emperor!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nPrince of Chen, defender of the defenceless, it falls upon you to protect your imperial cousin and – most importantly – his legacy. Come what may, the House of Han must prevail; a prince will become emperor!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nYour wisdom is without equal, Lu Zhi; under your guidance, the child emperor will flourish as did your former pupils! And should the need arise, trust that you are wise enough to take matters into your own hands, for the good of the empire!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nYour wisdom is without equal, Lu Zhi; under your guidance, the child emperor will flourish as did your former pupils! And should the need arise, trust that you are wise enough to take matters into your own hands, for the good of the empire!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nYou have come so very far, scourge of rebels, pirates and rogue warlords alike, and now guardian of the empire! Stay true, Tiger of Jiangdong, and hold these seditious elements at bay, no matter the cost!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nYou have come so very far, scourge of rebels, pirates and rogue warlords alike, and now guardian of the empire! Stay true, Tiger of Jiangdong, and hold these seditious elements at bay, no matter the cost!

localised_text.last_approved_text: \n\nThe needs of the people outweigh the needs of the elite, Tao Qian – this much you have always known. Now more than ever, you have the power to protect them, even if you must rock the empire to its very foundations!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: \n\nThe needs of the people outweigh the needs of the elite, Tao Qian – this much you have always known. Now more than ever, you have the power to protect them, even if you must rock the empire to its very foundations!

localised_text.last_approved_text:
- the stability of the empire remains in the balance.

The rise of the Zhang brothers was made possible by the weakness of an old and flawed government, further diminished by the ambitions of corrupt bureaucrats and rogue warlords.

 That which was once united is now dividing, and war looms large once again.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
- the stability of the empire remains in the balance.

The rise of the Zhang brothers was made possible by the weakness of an old and flawed government, further diminished by the ambitions of corrupt bureaucrats and rogue warlords.

 That which was once united is now dividing, and war looms large once again.

localised_text.last_approved_text:
Emperor, the Yellow Turbans are defeated, but the empire remains in disarray!

The imperial household has been ousted from Luoyang as rogue warlords and governors vie for control of that which is rightly yours. Acts of aggression are escalating, and China finds itself on the brink of civil war!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
Emperor, the Yellow Turbans are defeated, but the empire remains in disarray!

The imperial household has been ousted from Luoyang as rogue warlords and governors vie for control of that which is rightly yours. Acts of aggression are escalating, and China finds itself on the brink of civil war!

localised_text.last_approved_text:
Emperor, the Yellow Turbans are defeated, yet the stability of the empire lies in the balance.

The war has left many of your once-loyal subjects disillusioned, fearful for the future or driven by their own delusions of emperorship. China cannot succumb to the ravages of war once again!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
Emperor, the Yellow Turbans are defeated, yet the stability of the empire lies in the balance.

The war has left many of your once-loyal subjects disillusioned, fearful for the future or driven by their own delusions of emperorship. China cannot succumb to the ravages of war once again!

localised_text.last_approved_text: An escorted caravan approaches and your recognise the banners of your current employer – perhaps they harbour doubts as to your loyalties, and seek reassurance of your continued support? An envoy is brought before you as men unload chests from the baggage train. Humbly, he bows and asks what his lord may offer you in light of your services. Careful not to let your anticipation show, you peruse the treasures laid before you.

An envoy is brought before you as men unload chests from the baggage train. Humbly, he bows and asks what his lord may offer you in light of your services. Careful not to let your anticipation show, you peruse the treasures laid before you.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The young emperor – the aim of my ambitions. I have only to hold out my hand and grasp him tightly.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The young emperor – the aim of my ambitions. I have only to hold out my hand and grasp him tightly.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A capable general, but an incompetent leader. He controls the emperor, so I will pay lip service to him. For now…

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A capable general, but an incompetent leader. He controls the emperor, so I will pay lip service to him. For now…

localised_text.last_approved_text: He delayed my conquest of Wu province and now he controls it. He will be trouble in the future.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He delayed my conquest of Wu province and now he controls it. He will be trouble in the future.

localised_text.last_approved_text: An old man without ambition.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: An old man without ambition.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A warrior without loyalty. He turned my own generals against me and thwarted my conquest of Wu. I will destroy him!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A warrior without loyalty. He turned my own generals against me and thwarted my conquest of Wu. I will destroy him!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The capital lies in ashes – under my control it can rise again under a new government.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The capital lies in ashes – under my control it can rise again under a new government.

localised_text.last_approved_text: He is currently my friend, but that might change when he unifies the north.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He is currently my friend, but that might change when he unifies the north.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Despite me and Yuan Shao defeating him in battle, he still poses a threat. It remains to be seen if he is a man of ability or an idiot.

localised_text.last_approved_text: He cheated and defeated me in battle. Once I have regrouped, I will have my vengeance.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He cheated and defeated me in battle. Once I have regrouped, I will have my vengeance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Black Mountain bandit. Perhaps he and I can join forces?

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Black Mountain bandit. Perhaps he and I can join forces?

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Huang Zhong

localised_text.last_approved_text: Jia Xu

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Jia Xu

localised_text.last_approved_text: A virtuous man indeed. Hopefully he will be my ally to the south.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A virtuous man indeed. Hopefully he will be my ally to the south.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Truly a warrior without equal. Hopefully we will never meet on opposing sides of the battlefield.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Truly a warrior without equal. Hopefully we will never meet on opposing sides of the battlefield.

localised_text.last_approved_text: He and his son, Yuan Tan, are unjustly attacking my land. I must stand against the tide!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He and his son, Yuan Tan, are unjustly attacking my land. I must stand against the tide!

localised_text.last_approved_text: She operates, out of my ancestors temple, to raid and destroy the land. She must be removed!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: She operates, out of my ancestors temple, to raid and destroy the land. She must be removed!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lady Sun

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Lady Sun

localised_text.last_approved_text: Li Jue

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Li Jue

localised_text.last_approved_text: He used his father's death as an excuse for conquest. He is as ferocious as a tiger!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He used his father's death as an excuse for conquest. He is as ferocious as a tiger!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Choose whether to stand beside the tiger or the wolf. All in all, the wolf is the safer choice.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Choose whether to stand beside the tiger or the wolf. All in all, the wolf is the safer choice.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A ungrateful governor of the Han.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A ungrateful governor of the Han.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The bandits bring only chaos to the land. They must be removed.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The bandits bring only chaos to the land. They must be removed.

localised_text.last_approved_text: An unscrupulous hero in chaotic times. I shall be watchful of him.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: An unscrupulous hero in chaotic times. I shall be watchful of him.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A converted pirate who now guards my northern territories.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A converted pirate who now guards my northern territories.

localised_text.last_approved_text: My loyal vassal; an instrument through which to exercise my power.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: My loyal vassal; an instrument through which to exercise my power.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A capable general, but an incompetent leader. He holds both the emperor and the empire captive. For now I will do what I must to appease the usurper.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A capable general, but an incompetent leader. He holds both the emperor and the empire captive. For now I will do what I must to appease the usurper.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The lands are beset by conflict! I must restore order, for our noble traditions must be maintained!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The lands are beset by conflict! I must restore order, for our noble traditions must be maintained!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Once the seat of the Han, the capital still holds sway over those still loyal to the cause.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Once the seat of the Han, the capital still holds sway over those still loyal to the cause.

localised_text.last_approved_text: These fanatical brigands debase the very traditions and philosophies they purport to champion!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: These fanatical brigands debase the very traditions and philosophies they purport to champion!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Zhu Fu balances upon a knife-edge! His generals, long dismayed with his rule, have risen against him. His lands are weak and ripe for conquest...

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhu Fu balances upon a knife-edge! His generals, long dismayed with his rule, have risen against him. His lands are weak and ripe for conquest...

localised_text.last_approved_text: I shall crush him upon his own land and with his own men!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: I shall crush him upon his own land and with his own men!

localised_text.last_approved_text: His court consists of nothing but traitors and murders. In time, he will fall by my blade or his own incompetence.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: His court consists of nothing but traitors and murders. In time, he will fall by my blade or his own incompetence.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A man of virtue with capable warriors. If I'm ever in need, he may be able to assist me.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A man of virtue with capable warriors. If I'm ever in need, he may be able to assist me.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Among men: Lü Bu, among steeds: Red Hare. I am unstoppable!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Among men: Lü Bu, among steeds: Red Hare. I am unstoppable!

localised_text.last_approved_text: I fought by his side and he tried to have me killed. He will feel my vengeance.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: I fought by his side and he tried to have me killed. He will feel my vengeance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yuan Shu's power is enticing. Maybe we will form a temporary alliance?

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yuan Shu's power is enticing. Maybe we will form a temporary alliance?

localised_text.last_approved_text: "Bandit Queen"? It makes no difference, she will fall like all the rest!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: "Bandit Queen"? It makes no difference, she will fall like all the rest!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Ma Chao

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Ma Chao

localised_text.last_approved_text: My "ally" has abandoned me to my fate. Now I am defeated and on the run.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: My "ally" has abandoned me to my fate. Now I am defeated and on the run.

localised_text.last_approved_text: He may have won the battle, but not the war. The conflict continues to rage.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He may have won the battle, but not the war. The conflict continues to rage.

localised_text.last_approved_text: An old man without ambition.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: An old man without ambition.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Pang Tong

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Pang Tong

localised_text.last_approved_text: Sima Yi

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Sima Yi

localised_text.last_approved_text: He murdered my father. I will avenge him!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He murdered my father. I will avenge him!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Another old man without purpose or drive.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Another old man without purpose or drive.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yuan Shu has asked me to defeat this one and seize his lands.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yuan Shu has asked me to defeat this one and seize his lands.

localised_text.last_approved_text: My family's legacy rests in my hands. I will fulfil the destiny which heaven has laid afore me!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: My family's legacy rests in my hands. I will fulfil the destiny which heaven has laid afore me!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The White Tiger is nothing but a lord of bandits. I will crush him.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The White Tiger is nothing but a lord of bandits. I will crush him.

localised_text.last_approved_text: My so-called "lord"... If I'm not to be dragged down with him, I will soon have to act in my own interests.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: My so-called "lord"... If I'm not to be dragged down with him, I will soon have to act in my own interests.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Sun Quan

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Sun Quan

localised_text.last_approved_text: Sun Ren

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Sun Ren

localised_text.last_approved_text: Taishi Ci

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Taishi Ci

localised_text.last_approved_text: Xiahou Dun

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Xiahou Dun

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Xiahou Yuan

localised_text.last_approved_text: Xu Chu

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Xu Chu

localised_text.last_approved_text: Xu Huang

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Xu Huang

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Han Empire lingers on, usurpers and despoilers determined to stomp out my people once and for all.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Han Empire lingers on, usurpers and despoilers determined to stomp out my people once and for all.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Han appointed governor of Xu province. Maybe we can co-exist on friendly terms?

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Han appointed governor of Xu province. Maybe we can co-exist on friendly terms?

localised_text.last_approved_text: A mass-murderer and puppet of Yuan Shu. His invasion will bring nothing but destruction to the southern people.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A mass-murderer and puppet of Yuan Shu. His invasion will bring nothing but destruction to the southern people.

localised_text.last_approved_text: I will unite my people against this so-called "civilised" invasion.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: I will unite my people against this so-called "civilised" invasion.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Bandits and murderers all. I must protect my people: they must be stopped!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Bandits and murderers all. I must protect my people: they must be stopped!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yu Jin

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yu Jin

localised_text.last_approved_text: Currently my friend, but he may stand in my way as I unify the realm.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Currently my friend, but he may stand in my way as I unify the realm.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A mild breeze would topple him now, yet I will summon a storm to his lands!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A mild breeze would topple him now, yet I will summon a storm to his lands!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Kong Rong is a weak scholar. He will not stand in the way of my conquest.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Kong Rong is a weak scholar. He will not stand in the way of my conquest.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Truly, he is a soldier beyond compare. Hopefully I will never face him on the field of battle!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Truly, he is a soldier beyond compare. Hopefully I will never face him on the field of battle!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The capital… it is coveted by those who wish to install themselves as tyrants. I must take it first.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The capital… it is coveted by those who wish to install themselves as tyrants. I must take it first.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Heishan bandits are nothing but trouble. I should undertake measures to wipe them all out once and for all!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Heishan bandits are nothing but trouble. I should undertake measures to wipe them all out once and for all!

localised_text.last_approved_text: He has cost me so much. How dare this common bandit challenge me!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: He has cost me so much. How dare this common bandit challenge me!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The young emperor – he stands in the way of my rise to power.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The young emperor – he stands in the way of my rise to power.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Despite his imperial blood, he is remains a low-born peasant who doesn't deserve the lands over which he rules.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Despite his imperial blood, he is remains a low-born peasant who doesn't deserve the lands over which he rules.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yet another feckless fossil of a man in search of an early death!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yet another feckless fossil of a man in search of an early death!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The greatest warrior under heaven. If I can bring him to my side, I will be unstoppable!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The greatest warrior under heaven. If I can bring him to my side, I will be unstoppable!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The capital still holds power over those who have not yet let go of the past.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The capital still holds power over those who have not yet let go of the past.

localised_text.last_approved_text: His father served me well; undoubtedly, he will do the same.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: His father served me well; undoubtedly, he will do the same.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yue Jin

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Fei

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang Liao

localised_text.last_approved_text: A potential ally or another warlord to raid and subjugate? Time will tell.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A potential ally or another warlord to raid and subjugate? Time will tell.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Li Jue brings nothing but chaos to the land, yet he holds the emperor in his grasp. A situation ripe with opportunity!

localised_text.last_approved_text: I have lost too many friends to this monster. They will be avenged!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhang He

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Zhao Yun

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: An scheming ruler indeed. I should strike him now while he is occupied with larger threats.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A weak, aging scholar. His lands represent easy pickings.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A weak, aging scholar. His lands represent easy pickings.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Supposedly a virtuous ruler. I shall be careful of him, and his brothers also.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Having re-ignited your inner flame, you can now descend upon your enemies with a fury unmatched: Wild Fire. For several seasons, your strength in battle will be overwhelming. Once this period is over, however, your fire will go out and you will become vulnerable to counter-attacks.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Long have you waited for this moment. Your supplies are plentiful, your men poised for battle, and your own furious powers are ready to re-ignite. Soon, all of China will know you and fear you.\n\n To activate Wild Fire, navigate to the Faction panel and press the button next to the 'Goddess of Fire icon.

Soon, all of China will know you and fear you.\n\n To activate Wild Fire, navigate to the Faction panel and press the button next to the 'Goddess of Fire icon.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lady Zhurong has re-ignited her inner flame, and now descends upon her enemies with fury unmatched. For the next several seasons, she will be all but impossible to defeat. However, this fire of hers will die out, leaving her vulnerable to counter-attack.
